{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3241010,"name":"Jack","username":"J.F","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/ccd318/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-10-15T07:28:34.165Z","cooked":"

Our team is planning to use chain from #35 to #25h next season. We want to buy at WCP, and wonder whether its chain tensioners and chain tool for 25 is also suitable for #25h.
And if there is any recommend tool or something else, please feel free to tell me.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-10-15T07:28:34.165Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":15,"reads":246,"readers_count":245,"score":124.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":442453,"topic_slug":"buying-chain-suggestion","display_username":"Jack","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"/tag/25","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":59611,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/buying-chain-suggestion/442453/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3241013,"name":"Bryce Hanson","username":"BryceHanson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/brycehanson/{size}/159972_2.png","created_at":"2023-10-15T08:32:06.213Z","cooked":"

The Dark Soul chain tool that WCP sells is the best I’ve used, and will work for 25h. The “h” stands for “heavy” which means thicker sideplates, but it’ll still work. I’d recommend buying a few chain tools, because its possible to bend fhe pin that actually pressed fhe link in/out and you don’t wanna get caught halfway through and have to buy a new one!

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-10-15T08:32:06.213Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":238,"readers_count":237,"score":97.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":442453,"topic_slug":"buying-chain-suggestion","display_username":"Bryce Hanson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31172,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"125M/7525M | MC/GA "},"post_url":"/t/buying-chain-suggestion/442453/2","custom_user_title":"125M/7525M | MC/GA ","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3241015,"name":"Jack","username":"J.F","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/ccd318/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-10-15T08:47:35.728Z","cooked":"

Thank you!
However, isn’t DarkSoul 25 Chain Break sold by Andymark?

BryceHanson:

I’d recommend buying a few chain tools

Should I buy two DarkSoul or a DarkSoul with some Pin Replacement Kit For 25 Chain Break Tool?

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-10-15T08:47:35.728Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":224,"readers_count":223,"score":54.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":442453,"topic_slug":"buying-chain-suggestion","display_username":"Jack","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"/tag/25","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":59611,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/buying-chain-suggestion/442453/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3241017,"name":"Bryce Hanson","username":"BryceHanson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/brycehanson/{size}/159972_2.png","created_at":"2023-10-15T09:19:12.126Z","cooked":"

You’re totally right! WCP makes a very similar one, which is the one I’ve used.

WestCoast Products

Hand Tools

#25 and #35 chain tools are designed specifically with FIRST® Robotics Competition teams in mind. These handy tools makes it easy to break and assemble chain, and are also sized to assemble chain in place on your robot.

Price: USD 29.99

If you have the money for it I’d just buy 2, sometimes you’ve got 2 people who need to be working on chain. In a pinch 1 + pin replacement works.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-10-15T09:19:12.126Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":208,"readers_count":207,"score":56.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":442453,"topic_slug":"buying-chain-suggestion","display_username":"Bryce Hanson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://wcproducts.com/collections/belts-chain-gears/products/hand-tools","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Hand Tools – WestCoast Products","clicks":16}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":59611,"username":"J.F","name":"Jack","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/ccd318/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31172,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"125M/7525M | MC/GA "},"post_url":"/t/buying-chain-suggestion/442453/4","custom_user_title":"125M/7525M | MC/GA ","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3241028,"name":"Stewart Riley","username":"Strategic","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/strategic/{size}/10157_2.png","created_at":"2023-10-15T12:48:31.954Z","cooked":"

For chain breaks, both the Dark Soul and the WCP tool are excellent and work much better than most of the other tools you’ll find on the market. But definitely get the replacement pins (two or three is a good idea.)

The chain tensioners are fantastic, especially if you’re looking at the turnbuckle design. We used four of these on our two arm rotation chains this year and they kept the chain very tight through a lot of matches without needing adjustment. Of course, like with all in-line tensioners, they do have their limits. They can’t pass over sprockets, so they’re use is limited to chain runs where you have a section that never needs to do that. But for their use-cases, they work really well.
